item.title: Study Notes on Network Theory
item.description: This blog aims to summerize the essential theory and method of network study.

item.title: Renormalization Group: A Descriptive Overview
item.description: Renormalization Group Approach in Dynamical System The renormalization group (RG) method is an approximation technique initially developed for solving strongly interacting many-body problems in quantum field theory, where perturbative solutions deviate from the actual solutions. The fundamental concept of the renormalization group approach is to eliminate irrelevant degrees of freedom in a physical system while preserving its essential characteristics ( Citation: P. Kopietz, 2010 P. Kopietz,  F.  (2010).   Introduction to the Functional Renormalization Group (1).
